newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Sabca 1996 net profit 318 mln bfr.
newsitem.headline: Sabca 1996 net profit 318 mln bfr.

text.p: NOTE - Belgian aerospace company SA Belge de Constructions Aeronautiques (Sabca) is 52.96 percent owned by Dassault Belgique Aviation, a unit of France's Dassault Industries SA, and 42.80 percent held by the administrators of bankrupt Dutch plane maker Fokker NV.

Sabca said in a statement a pickup in the civil aviation sector was being confirmed and production of Falcon parts grew in 1996. In 1997 production of Airbus A330/340 tailcones was being stepped up to five from three a month. On a world level civil aviation was nevertheless marked by intense competition which required big efforts in terms of productivity.
The company said its order book stood at 13.02 billion francs at the end of 1996.
It forecast 1997 turnover in excess of six billion francs, while profits would remain at a "satisfactory level".
